it's all going to render out so onto the

this is kind of a quick version but you

to kind of permeate through so really
don't be scared about this
good helping of cracked black pepper so
basically the flavor components to your
classic duck confit is garlic thyme salt

as far as prep now I want you to watch
how this gets all packaged together and
folded this is a this is kind of
important we're going to make this very

I didn't go super tight all right it's

fold side down fold side down and now

this one you're going to wrap okay
just like I did the first one and crimp

little tighter alright there's my third
piece of foil fold side down fold side
down all right now this one gets wrapped
the same exact way and you're just going
to press just a little bit tighter and
by the fourth wrapping here you're going
to have a nice nice package it's going
to go in the oven again the last one
fold side down and this gets wrapped and
sealed
and you are ready for the oven now
traditionally duck confit it's cooked in
a large basically like a Dutch oven
almost and it's totally covered in duck
fat that's the traditional way I didn't
have a you know 10 pounds of duck fat so
to me this is a great way to do it
because it's wrapped so tight it's
basically the fats going to render out
of those legs and it it'll be surrounded
by its own fat that's really what confit
means it's something cooked for a long
time its own fat that one in an oven at
225 for two and a half hours okay so it
does cook a long time two and a half
hours at 225 I'll put that on the recipe
page
it was chilled overnight okay it's got
to stay overnight let it come to room

going to keep unwrapping now when I get
